|flash1type = CMOS Serial |fla1_num = <!-- 1,2,3,4 --> |fla1chip = Macronix;MX25L4006EM1I-12G; |flash1size = 512 KiB |flash1maxsize = <!-- Maximum size firmware can be in bytes --> |flash2type = SSD (SATA) |fla2_num = <!-- 1,2,3,4 --> |fla2chip = Transcend;; |flash2size = 16 GiB |flash2maxsize = <!-- Maximum size firmware can be in bytes -->

|eth_cpu = true |eth2chip = Marvell;88E1318; |lan_ports = 1 |lan_speed = 1GbE |ethstandard = <!-- auto --> |auto_mdix = <!-- mdix support --> |sup_jumbo = <!-- Jumbo frames support --> |ethoui = 18:03:73

|serial = yes,, 4-pin header,, populated,, 3.3V TTL,, (115200 8N1), |jtag = <!-- Full JTAG info -->

}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== "Kace_Mini V2.0" and "2011.04.12" is silkscreened on both sides of board.
OS is installed on a 16GB Transcend SSD using the SATA port.
===Hardware specification=== *CPU: ''[[Marvell]]'' 88F6282 @2GHz ARM (v5) *Memory: 2GB (DDR3) SDRAM *Storage: 512KB (CMOS) Serial Flash, :16GB SSD ''Transcend'' (SATA II) *Network: 1x Gigabit Ethernet port *USB: 2x USB 2.0 ports *Power Source: 19V 1.58A via barrel
==Links of Interest== [https://forum.doozan.com/read.php?2,61344,page=1 Debian on Dell Kace M300], from the Doozan Forums; A forum thread spanning from mid-2018 to the present on installing/running modern Debian armel with the Bodhi Kirkwood FDT kernel and rootfs.
==Pictures== <center>'''User Images''' <gallery mode="slideshow"> File:Dell Kace M300 Top.jpeg|Board Top File:Dell Kace M300 Bottom.jpeg|Board Bottom File:Dell Kace M300 Internal.jpeg|Internal Bottom </gallery></center>[[Has images::internal| ]]
